verses.verse: And Moses <WH4872> answered <WH6030> and said, <WH559> But, behold, <WH2005> they will not believe <WH539> me, nor <WH3808> listen <WH8085> to my voice: <WH6963> for they will say, <WH559> The LORD <WH3068> has not appeared <WH7200> to you.
And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> to him, What <WH4100> is that in your hand? <WH3027> And he said, <WH559> A rod. <WH4294>

And he said, <WH559> Cast <WH7993> it on the ground. <WH776> And he cast <WH7993> it on the ground, <WH776> and it became <WH1961> a serpent; <WH5175> and Moses <WH4872> fled <WH5127> from before <WH6440> it.

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> Put <WH7971> forth <WH7971> your hand, <WH3027> and take <WH270> it by the tail. <WH2180> And he put <WH7971> forth <WH7971> his hand, <WH3027> and caught <WH2388> it, and it became <WH1961> a rod <WH4294> in his hand: <WH3709>

That they may believe <WH539> that the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of their fathers, <WH1> the God <WH430> of Abraham, <WH85> the God <WH430> of Isaac, <WH3327> and the God <WH430> of Jacob, <WH3290> has appeared <WH7200> to you.

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> furthermore <WH5750> to him, Put <WH935> now <WH4994> your hand <WH3027> into your bosom. <WH2436> And he put <WH935> his hand <WH3027> into his bosom: <WH2436> and when he took <WH3318> it out, behold, <WH2009> his hand <WH3027> was leprous <WH6879> as snow. <WH7950>

And he said, <WH559> Put <WH7725> your hand <WH3027> into <WH413> your bosom <WH2436> again. <WH7725> And he put <WH7725> his hand <WH3027> into <WH413> his bosom <WH2436> again; <WH7725> and plucked <WH3318> it out of his bosom, <WH2436> and, behold, <WH2009> it was turned <WH7725> again <WH7725> as his other flesh. <WH1320>

And it shall come <WH1961> to pass, if <WH518> they will not believe <WH539> you, neither <WH3808> listen <WH8085> to the voice <WH6963> of the first <WH7223> sign, <WH226> that they will believe <WH539> the voice <WH6963> of the latter <WH314> sign. <WH226>

And it shall come <WH1961> to pass, if <WH518> they will not believe <WH539> also <WH1571> these <WH428> two <WH8147> signs, <WH226> neither <WH3808> listen <WH8085> to your voice, <WH6963> that you shall take <WH3947> of the water <WH4325> of the river, <WH2975> and pour <WH8210> it on the dry <WH3004> land: and the water <WH4325> which <WH834> you take <WH3947> out of the river <WH2975> shall become <WH1961> blood <WH1818> on the dry <WH3006> land.

And Moses <WH4872> said <WH559> to the LORD, <WH3068> O my LORD, <WH136> I am not eloquent, <WH376> <WH1697> neither <WH1571> heretofore, <WH8543> nor <WH1571> since <WH227> you have spoken <WH1696> to your servant: <WH5650> but I am slow <WH3515> of speech, <WH6310> and of a slow <WH3515> tongue. <WH3956>

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> to him, Who <WH4310> has made <WH7760> man's <WH120> mouth? <WH6310> or <WH176> who <WH4310> makes <WH7760> the dumb, <WH483> or <WH176> deaf, <WH2795> or <WH176> the seeing, <WH6493> or <WH176> the blind? <WH5787> have not I the LORD? <WH3068>
Now <WH6258> therefore go, <WH3212> and I will be with your mouth, <WH6310> and teach <WH3384> you what <WH834> you shall say. <WH1696>
And he said, <WH559> O my LORD, <WH136> send, <WH7971> I pray <WH4994> you, by the hand <WH3027> of him whom you will send. <WH7971>

And the anger <WH639> of the LORD <WH3068> was kindled <WH2734> against Moses, <WH4872> and he said, <WH559> Is not Aaron <WH175> the Levite <WH3881> your brother? <WH251> I know <WH3045> that he can speak <WH1696> well. And also, <WH1571> behold, <WH2009> he comes <WH3318> forth <WH3318> to meet <WH7125> you: and when he sees <WH7200> you, he will be glad <WH8056> in his heart. <WH3820>

And you shall speak <WH1696> to him, and put <WH7760> words <WH1697> in his mouth: <WH6310> and I will be with your mouth, <WH6310> and with his mouth, <WH6310> and will teach <WH3384> you what <WH853> <WH834> you shall do. <WH6213>
And he shall be your spokesman <WH1696> to the people: <WH5971> and he shall be, even he shall be to you instead of a mouth, <WH6310> and you shall be to him instead of God. <WH430>
And you shall take <WH3947> this <WH2088> rod <WH4294> in your hand, <WH3027> with which <WH834> you shall do <WH6213> signs. <WH226>

And Moses <WH4872> went <WH3212> and returned <WH7725> to Jethro <WH3503> his father <WH2859> in law, <WH2859> and said <WH559> to him, Let me go, <WH3212> I pray <WH4994> you, and return <WH7725> to my brothers <WH251> which <WH834> are in Egypt, <WH4714> and see <WH7200> whether <WH5750> they be yet <WH5750> alive. <WH2416> And Jethro <WH3503> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> Go <WH3212> in peace. <WH7965>

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> to Moses <WH4872> in Midian, <WH4080> Go, <WH3212> return <WH7725> into Egypt: <WH4714> for all <WH3605> the men <WH582> are dead <WH4191> which sought <WH1245> your life. <WH5315>

And Moses <WH4872> took <WH3947> his wife <WH802> and his sons, <WH1121> and set <WH7392> them on an ass, <WH2543> and he returned <WH7725> to the land <WH776> of Egypt: <WH4714> and Moses <WH4872> took <WH3947> the rod <WH4294> of God <WH430> in his hand. <WH3027>

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> When you go <WH3212> to return <WH7725> into Egypt, <WH4714> see <WH7200> that you do <WH6213> all <WH3605> those wonders <WH4159> before <WH6440> Pharaoh, <WH6547> which <WH834> I have put <WH7760> in your hand: <WH3027> but I will harden <WH2388> his heart, <WH3820> that he shall not let the people <WH5971> go. <WH7971>
And you shall say <WH559> to Pharaoh, <WH6547> Thus <WH3541> said <WH559> the LORD, <WH3068> Israel <WH3478> is my son, <WH1121> even my firstborn: <WH1060>

And I say <WH559> to you, Let my son <WH1121> go, <WH7971> that he may serve <WH5647> me: and if you refuse <WH3985> to let him go, <WH7971> behold, <WH2009> I will slay <WH2026> your son, <WH1121> even your firstborn. <WH1060>
And it came <WH1961> to pass by the way <WH1870> in the inn, <WH4411> that the LORD <WH3068> met <WH6298> him, and sought <WH1245> to kill <WH4191> him.

Then Zipporah <WH6855> took <WH3947> a sharp <WH6864> stone, <WH6697> and cut <WH3772> off the foreskin <WH6190> of her son, <WH1121> and cast <WH5060> it at his feet, <WH7272> and said, <WH559> Surely <WH3588> a bloody <WH1818> husband <WH2860> are you to me.
So he let him go: <WH7503> then <WH227> she said, <WH559> A bloody <WH1818> husband <WH2860> you are, because of the circumcision. <WH4139>

And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> to Aaron, <WH175> Go <WH3212> into the wilderness <WH4057> to meet <WH7125> Moses. <WH4872> And he went, <WH3212> and met <WH6298> him in the mount <WH2022> of God, <WH430> and kissed <WH5401> him.

And Moses <WH4872> told <WH5046> Aaron <WH175> all <WH3605> the words <WH1697> of the LORD <WH3068> who <WH834> had sent <WH7971> him, and all <WH3605> the signs <WH226> which <WH834> he had commanded <WH6680> him.
And Moses <WH4872> and Aaron <WH175> went <WH3212> and gathered <WH622> together all <WH3605> the elders <WH2205> of the children <WH1121> of Israel: <WH3478>

And Aaron <WH175> spoke <WH1696> all <WH3605> the words <WH1697> which <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> had spoken <WH1696> to Moses, <WH4872> and did <WH6213> the signs <WH226> in the sight <WH5869> of the people. <WH5971>

And the people <WH5971> believed: <WH539> and when they heard <WH8085> that the LORD <WH3068> had visited <WH6485> the children <WH1121> of Israel, <WH3478> and that he had looked <WH7200> on their affliction, <WH6040> then they bowed <WH6915> their heads and worshipped. <WH7812>
